snippet: The more than two dozen construction workers were abducted in late January during a road project near the Sudan-South Sudan border.
abstract: Sudanese rebels release more than two dozen Chinese construction workers who were abducted in December; Sudanese government, which has been steadfastly supported by China, implies that the newly independent nation of South Sudan helped gain the release.

byline.contributor: Isma’il Kushkush contributed reporting from Khartoum, Sudan, and Michael Wines from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The more than two dozen construction workers were abducted in late January during a road project near the Sudan-South Sudan border.

headline.main: Rebels Free Chinese Workers in Sudan, Red Cross Says
headline.print_headline: Rebels Free Chinese Workers In Sudan, Red Cross Says

keywords.value: International Committee of the Red Cross
keywords.name: organizations
